page.content: Crail Summer Fair run by the Community Council during August is a great attraction for summer visitors with flags decroating the streets and a Pipe band. A Convenor appointed early, has to deal with booking entertainments and halls, car parking, printing and publicity. There are competitions, games and stalls selling local produce. After the Fair Queen has opened the Fair, The Radio Road Show takes over. There is a Pet show and large raffle. Proceeds from the stalls are divided equally between the organisations running them and the Community Council, who use the money to provide extra amenities fro the Burgh. The weather is always a worry, of course,with the chance of a last minute cancellation, but each year is always better than the previous one.
